required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Two Pericardial Bioprostheses in AVR
clinical_study.official_title: Early and 1-year Hemodynamic Performance and Clinical Outcomes After Aortic Valve Replacement Using Two Pericardial Bioprostheses: A Multicenter Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to compare early and 1-year hemodynamic performance and clinical outcomes after aortic valve replacement using two pericardial bioprosthesis, Avalus and Carpentier Edwards Perimount Magna Ease.

detailed_description.textblock: This trial was designed as a multicenter randomized, controlled trial to recruit 386 patients who undergo aortic valve replacement with pericardial bioprosthesis. Patients were randomized by use of a randomization table. Bioprosthesis was chosen between Avalus or Carpentier Edwards Perimount Magna Ease according to the randomization result. The primary end point is postoperative 1-year transvalvular mean pressure gradient. The secondary end points are postoperative 1-year effective orifice area, operative mortality, operative morbidities, 1-year overall survival, 1-year freedom from cardiac death and 1-year freedom from valve-related events.

primary_outcome.description: transvalvular mean pressure gradient measured by trans-thoracic echocardiography

secondary_outcome.description: effective orifice area measured by trans-thoracic echocardiography

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at postoperative 30 days or at the time of discharge
secondary_outcome.description: any death within 30 days after surgery or during the same hospital admission

low cardiac output syndrome, bleeding reoperation, perioperative myocardial infarction, stroke, acute kidney injury, respiratory complication, new onset atrial fibrillation, mediastinitis, surgical wound infection
Any death related to cardiac events, including sudden death during follow-up
valve-related mortality, thromboembolism, bleeding, endocarditis, reoperation

arm_group.description: patients who will undergo aortic valve replacement with Avalus bioprosthesis
patients who will undergo aortic valve replacement with Carpentier-Edwards Perimount Magna Ease bioprosthesis

intervention.description: aortic valve replacement with AVALUS bioprosthesis
aortic valve replacement with Carpentier-Edwards Perimount Magna Ease bioprosthesis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients who are going to undergo aortic valve replacement with bioprosthesis
Exclusion Criteria:
- heart failure with severe LV dysfunction (LV EF <30%)
- active infective endocarditis
- with other critical cardiovascular disease (e.g. acute aortic dissection)
- with other critical comorbities by which the expected life span is less than 1 year
- inadequate participant by the researcher's discretion

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD will not be shared because it is not allowed by our institutional IRB.
